result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Elissa Ann Esser
Current: 413 1/2 S. Hubbard St, Horicon, WI 53032 United States  (Effective: 04-05-2022)
Prior: PO Box 226, Jackson, WI 53037

10:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Elissa Ann Esser in court.  Attorney Alyssa F. George in court for Elissa Ann Esser. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within/waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions: Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not be in a motor vehicle operated by anyone under the influence of any intoxicant. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
